title: Need help with finding a typeface
content:
Hi guys,

I am looking for a typeface similar to Neo Sans from Agfa monotype. ( [http://www.monotype.co.uk/neosans/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080825145450/http:/www.monotype.co.uk/neosans/ "http://www.monotype.co.uk/neosans/")) The reason why I am not able to use Neo Sans is because it does not have a Cyrillic alternative and so I am forced to find something similar.

If any of you have suggestions, that would be appreciated.

Thanks.

Vlad

 [‹ Kerning list two](http://web.archive.org/web/20080825145450/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45216 "Go to previous forum topic") [Rules for punctuation spacing in spanish ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080825145450/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45156 "Go to next forum topic")
author: andrei_bva

comments.content:
Actually, There seems to be a cyrillic version available within the ’Neo Sans (Pro)’ family/range. _\> [fonts.com/FindFonts/detail.htm?pid=4338177?lang=EN](http://web.archive.org/web/20080825145450/http:/www.fonts.com/FindFonts/detail.htm?pid=4338177?lang=EN)_

Dav

Dav,

First of all thanks and ... duh ... :)

I only checked myfont.com and the option for cyrillic didn’t show any glyphs so I assumed it didn’t have any.

Vlad

MyFonts.com doesn’t sell Monotype fonts so their showings for these fonts cannot be relied upon.

[Magistral](http://web.archive.org/web/20080825145450/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/paratype/magistral_multilingual_ot/) is a similar design which includes Cyrillic.
